title: 114_s2327
content: The "Foster EITC Act of 2015" is cited as the short title. It includes a permanent extension of modifications to the Earned Income Tax Credit. The "Foster EITC Act of 2015" includes amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, such as increasing the credit percentage for families with 3 or more children and raising the limit for joint returns to $5,000. The "Foster EITC Act of 2015" raises the limit for joint returns to $5,000 and adjusts certain subsections of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The amendments are effective for taxable years starting after December 31, 2014. The "Foster EITC Act of 2015" increases the limit for joint returns to $5,000 and makes adjustments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 for taxable years starting after December 31, 2014. The "Foster EITC Act of 2015" raises the credit amounts for individuals with no qualifying children under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The table in section 32(b)(2) is amended to increase the credit to $8,820 and $10,425. Inflation adjustments are also made for these amounts. The "Foster EITC Act of 2015" increases the credit amounts for individuals with no children under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The table in section 32(b)(1)(A) is amended to raise the credit to $8,820 and $10,425, with inflation adjustments made. Additionally, the eligibility age for certain childless individuals and youth formerly in foster care is lowered to age 21 (or age 18 for youth formerly in foster care). The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include a new subparagraph defining "youth formerly in foster care" as individuals who were in foster care at or after the age of 16. Additionally, a new section is added for returns relating to youth in foster care under subpart B of part III of subchapter A of chapter 61. "SEC. 6050X. RETURNS RELATING TO YOUTH IN FOSTER CARE." The section requires State, local, or tribal agencies to report data to the Adoption and Foster Care Analysis and Reporting System for individuals in foster care aged 16 and above. The return must include the individual's name, date of birth, and TIN. The section requires reporting of individual's information for the Adoption and Foster Care Analysis and Reporting System, including name, date of birth, TIN, and other prescribed details by the Secretary. Individuals must be furnished with a written statement containing the required information for the return. The section mandates reporting individual information for the Adoption and Foster Care Analysis and Reporting System, including name, date of birth, TIN, and other details. A written statement with the required information must be provided to individuals by January 31 of the following year. Penalties are applicable for non-compliance. Sec. 6050X mandates reporting individual information for the Adoption and Foster Care Analysis and Reporting System. Effective after December 31, 2014, the amendments apply to taxable years. SEC. 4 simplifies the Earned Income Tax Credit. Modification of Abandoned Spouse Rule: Amends Section 32(c)(1) of the Internal Revenue Code for married individuals living apart with a qualifying child for more than half of the taxable year. The tax code is amended to clarify that individuals not living with their spouse by the end of the taxable year are not considered married. Additionally, rules regarding the presence of a qualifying child for tax credit eligibility are simplified. The tax code is amended to allow individuals without a qualifying child to claim the tax credit if the child is claimed by another family member. The tax code allows individuals without a qualifying child to claim the tax credit if the child is claimed by another family member. Additionally, taxpayers may be eligible for the credit for a worker without a qualifying child if the qualifying children do not have a valid social security number. The tax code is amended to allow eligible individuals without a qualifying child to claim the tax credit if the child is not claimed by anyone else. This amendment applies to taxable years starting after December 31, 2014.
